unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Disjoint vs. Independent
question_text: Which of the following statements is true concerning disjoint and independent events?

choices.text: If one knows events are disjoint, the events are more likely to be independent.
The relationship of disjoint to independent events depends on the situation.

solution:
Disjoint events, by definition, cannot happen at the same time.

Therefore, if one event happens, the probability of the second event happening becomes zero. In turn, since the probability of the second event changes, the events cannot be independent.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'A'.
